definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
a whole lifetime (idiom); all my life
nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
Science and technology is the number one productive force (from 1978 speech by Deng Xiaoping 鄧小平|邓小平 introducing the Four Modernizations 四個現代化|四个现代化).
pinyin: ke1 xue2 ji4 shu4 shi4 di4 yi1 sheng1 chan3 li4
containing_words.word: 科學技術是第一生產力

sentences.english: Then when you get older and think back, you’ll be able to enjoy it a second time.
sentences.chinese: 當你年老回首往事時，便能再次享受你的一生。

sentences.english: You know, in one lifetime you can't learn everything that's good.
sentences.chinese: 要知道，人的一生不可能將所有的事情都學得很出色。

sentences.english: Into every life some rain must fall.
sentences.chinese: 每私人一生都得逢上陰雨。

sentences.english: You are my life away a never-ending road.
sentences.chinese: 你是我一生走不完的路。

sentences.english: Hope scars, realized that even with life, are often trapped.
sentences.chinese: 望滿身傷痕，才明白即使嬉笑一生，也常被困。

sentences.english: For whom, for whom, who has waited for eternity in a thousand years?
sentences.chinese: 爲誰傾盡一生，爲誰把千年等待刻成一個永恆？

sentences.english: Many people, because so lonely life by one.
sentences.chinese: 很多人，因爲錯愛一人而寂寞一生。

sentences.english: Whole life blown away in the brink of eye.
sentences.chinese: 你的一生在轉眼之間就毀掉了。

sentences.english: But the mystique that surrounded the terrorist chieftain in life is persisting in death.
sentences.chinese: 但是圍繞這位恐怖主義首領一生的謎團卻並未解開。

sentences.english: Take a candid shot of WeiSheng shitting and he will give you the smell of a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 偷拍多多大便，他會放一生難忘的臭屁給你聞。

sentences.english: In fact, nothing teaches you sanctification like the life of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，沒有什麼比持續一生的婚姻更神聖的。

sentences.english: He devoted all his life to the cause of military aviation.
sentences.chinese: 他把一生都獻給了軍用航空事業。

sentences.english: As a result, many people live a mediocre life without living for a true purpose.
sentences.chinese: 結果很多人一生碌碌無爲，沒有真正的目標。

sentences.english: It is difficult to verbalize his lifetime of frustrations.
sentences.chinese: 他坎坷的一生很難用言語來表達。

sentences.english: I had only been in one other train in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一生中只上過另外一列火車。

sentences.english: My husband Clay Lohmann is the greatest inspiration in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我的丈夫粘土羅曼是我一生中最大的靈感。

definition: generation/period of 30 years/one's whole lifetime/lifelong/age/era/times/the whole world/the First (of numbered European kings)
a whole lifetime (idiom); all my life
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
life (a person's whole life)/in one's entire life
